attributes.action: Communicate to the BBC the absolute delight of all motor racing fans that the coverage of Formula 1 is to return to the BBC and to ask him to guide, encourage, persuade and, if necessary instruct, the BBC to employ Martin Brundle as their preferred expert analyst and commentator and to employ Murray Walker in an active on-screen role of his choice in the presentation of this sport
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: The BBC have secured the TV rights for formula 1 motor racing for 2009 onwards, in competition with ITV. It is generally accepted by enthusiasts of the sport that the ITV coverage was disappointing, with the exception of the analysis provided by Martin Brundle. Murray Walker was the BBC's lead motor racing presenter for nearly 50 years and is unrivalled in his ability to communicate and reflect the excitement and tension in the sport. He is known for his ability to excite the uninterested all around the world.

reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
